articles.headline: Sprint and T-Mobile Merger Faces New Hurdle With Lawsuit by States
articles.snippet: Ten attorneys general filed a federal lawsuit to block the $26 billion deal between the third- and fourth-largest wireless carriers in the United States.
articles.abstract: Ten attorneys general filed a federal lawsuit to block the $26 billion deal between the third- and fourth-largest wireless carriers in the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: Executives at T-Mobile and Sprint have pitched the merger of their companies as a way for the country to greatly expand its 5G network, a priority for President Trump, who has argued that the widespread adoption of the technology is crucial to national security.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Matthew Goldstein

articles.headline: House Opens Tech Antitrust Inquiry With Look at Threat to News Media
articles.snippet: Local journalism has been pushed “to the verge of extinction,” said a member of a committee that plans 18 months of hearings and other scrutiny of the big technology platforms.
articles.abstract: Local journalism has been pushed “to the verge of extinction,” said a member of a committee that plans 18 months of hearings and other scrutiny of the big technology platforms.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A congressional investigation into the power of big tech companies began on Tuesday with bipartisan concern from lawmakers that the government’s lax oversight of the industry may be doing more harm than good.

articles.headline: He Tried to Plug a Wasp Nest. He Ended Up Sparking California’s Biggest Wildfire.
articles.snippet: A newly disclosed investigation suggests that the biggest wildfire in California history was likely started by a single man and a single spark.
articles.abstract: A newly disclosed investigation suggests that the biggest wildfire in California history was likely started by a single man and a single spark.
articles.lead_paragraph: POTTER VALLEY, Calif. — It was a fire that crossed mountain ranges and valleys, that spanned multiple counties and shocked Californians by its sheer scale — by far the biggest wildfire in modern state history. And yet a newly disclosed investigation suggests it was probably started by a single man and a single spark.

articles.headline: Chinese Tourists’ U.S. Spending Has Plunged. The Trade War May Be to Blame.
articles.snippet: The number of Chinese tourists is falling. And that’s especially painful to businesses they favor, because they tend to spend more than other visitors.
articles.abstract: The number of Chinese tourists is falling. And that’s especially painful to businesses they favor, because they tend to spend more than other visitors.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new battlefront has opened in the trade war between the United States and China: the $1.6 trillion American travel industry.

articles.headline: Census Fight Grows as House Panel Backs Contempt and Trump Asserts Privilege
articles.snippet: A committee recommended that the House hold Attorney General William P. Barr and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross in contempt as the president invoked his secrecy powers.
articles.abstract: A committee recommended that the House hold Attorney General William P. Barr and Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross in contempt as the president invoked his secrecy powers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A House committee voted on Wednesday to recommend that two cabinet secretaries be held in contempt of Congress, hours after President Trump invoked executive privilege to block disclosure of crucial documents on the decision to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Charlie Savage
